intro: Aeschynanthus lineatus, commonly known as the lineated ivy plant, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and attractive, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Aeschynanthus lineatus is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and vibrant blooms.
